alert.note: Alert for Wicomico (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued December 18 at 3:47AM EST until December 18 at 6:00AM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wakefield has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Wicomico County in southeastern Maryland... * Until 600 AM EST. * At 347 AM EST, radar and gauge reports indicated heavy rain falling across the warned area. Between 2.5 and 4.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is likely ongoing. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Gauges reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Salisbury, Fruitland, Salisbury University, Delmar, Hebron, Parsonsburg, Pittsville, Mardela Springs, Shad Point, Lakewood, Eden, Catchpenny, Allen, Chesapeake Heights, Trinity, Salisbury-Wicomico, Green Hill, Royal Oak, Melson and Wetipquin. FLASH FLOOD...GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
